intro: Leucophae bolleana, commonly known as the Bolleana moonflower, is a striking plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its large, white, night-blooming flowers that emit a strong, sweet fragrance. The plant has broad, heart-shaped leaves that are usually a deep green color. Its flowers open only at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. The Bolleana moonflower is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique blooming pattern.
